document_data.name: Araluen
document_data.titles: Horned Aspect; Step-daughter of Talona; Child of Light
document_data.dobnotes: Sent to the Great Dale and captured by the [[Rotting Man]]
document_data.destroyednotes: returned to the Outer Planes after her fight with the Rotting Man on [[Mirtul 7]]
document_data.mainbody: '''Araluen''', '''Ash''', the '''Child of Light''', the '''Horned Aspect''' and '''The Step-daughter of Talona''' were fragments of a divine being sent by [[Lurue]] to the [[Great Dale]] in {{yearlink|1368}} to bolster the forces fighting the [[Rotting Man]].{{cite book/Lady of Poison|122-123|13}} After the latter captured most of his essence, he twisted it into the Step-Daughter of Talona; the remainder of her hope formed a small baby, capable of speaking only the word 'Ash'.{{cite book/Lady of Poison|1-2|Prologue}} Both aspects were reunited in {{yearlink|1373}}, reforming a complete Araluen who drove the Rotting Man off of Dun-Tharos.
document_data.Possessions: A pony named Henri was procured for Ash in [[Culdorn]].{{cite book/Lady of Poison|45|5}} The [[Nentyarch]] gifted her with a magical leather bridle, chased with green thread, that allowed the horse to always find its way back to safety, to [[Yeshelmaar]], and to never lose its way.{{cite book/Lady of Poison|129|13}} The fully restored Araluen carried a blade of celestial fire.{{cite book/Lady of Poison|298|31}}
document_data.Activities: Until {{yearlink|1373}}, both Ash and the Step-Daughter of Talona remained in their place of birth: Ash remained in [[Fullpoint]] with her adoptive father, Hemish,{{cite book/Lady of Poison|18|2}} while the Step-Daughter remained encysted in the [[Thieving Ash]] at Dun-Tharos.{{cite book/Lady of Poison|288-291|30}}Albeit the Thieving Ash was in [[Dun-Tharos]] as of 1373, the forces of Talona had not occupied the Close until 1371. Given the light was captured in 1368, there are either multiple Thieving Ashes or the tree was moved after the capture.
document_data.Relationships: Ash loved her adoptive father, [[Hemish]], and she was totally taken in with her pony, [[Henri]].{{cite book/Lady of Poison|45|5}} Though her feelings towards the traitor [[Fallon]] were unclear, she redeemed him for his betrayal; the Step-Daughter of Talona seemed to have no strong feelings other than her obedience to the Rotting Man. After the synthesis of both aspects restored Araluen, she kept Ash's feelings rather than the Step-Daughter's.
